intro: Mecodium capense, commonly known as the Cape mecodium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Mecodium capense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and adaptability to coastal environments.
